definition: to nibble away at sth/to eat into/to erode

sentences.english: This eclipse will be difficult for a number of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 因为几个原因，这个月蚀将变得有些困难。

sentences.english: There are many ways this eclipse may affect you, and one is travel.
sentences.chinese: 这次月蚀有很多种方法去影响你，其中一个就是旅行。

sentences.english: The gates of mercy, like an eclipse, darken our undersides .
sentences.chinese: 仁慈的门户，犹如月蚀，阴暗了我们的下腹。

sentences.english: This won't be an easy eclipse, but you are flexible and resourceful.
sentences.chinese: 这不会是一样容易的月蚀，但你是灵活和足智多谋的。

sentences.english: In a lunar eclipse, Earth passes between the sun and the moon.
sentences.chinese: 在一次月蚀中，地球将从太阳和月球之间经过。

sentences.english: The week before and after the lunar eclipse is a time to postpone important decisions.
sentences.chinese: 在月蚀的前一周和后一周是延缓重要决定的时间。

sentences.english: Next month, on August 5, we will have a lunar (full moon) eclipse in Aquarius.
sentences.chinese: 下个月8月5日，我们会迎来一次水瓶座月蚀。

definition: to bewilder/to dazzle and confuse/the planet Mars
the seven planets of premodern astronomy (the Sun, the Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)

the twelve equatorial constellations or signs of the zodiac in Western astronomy and astrology, namely: Aries 白羊[Bai2 yang2], Taurus 金牛[Jin4 niu2], Gemini 雙子|双子[Shuang1 zi3], Cancer 巨蟹[Ju4 xie4], Leo 獅子|狮子[Shi1 zi3], Virgo 室女[Shi4 nu:3], Libra 天秤[Tian1 cheng4], Scorpio 天蠍|天蝎[Tian1 xie1], Sagittarius 人馬|人马[Ren2 ma3], Capricorn 摩羯[Mo2 jie2], Aquarius 寶瓶|宝瓶[Bao3 ping2], Pisces 雙魚|双鱼[Shuang1 yu2]
full moon/whole month/baby's one-month old birthday
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
